title: Shell, in a Turning Point, Says Its Oil Production Has Peaked
summary: Europe’s largest oil and gas producer said oil production would gradually decline 1 or 2 percent annually, underscoring the company’s desire to shift to greener energy.

title: Biden and the Fed Leave 1970s Inflation Fears Behind
summary: Administration and Fed officials argue that workers not getting enough stimulus help is a larger concern than potential spikes in consumer prices.

title: Texas Storms, California Heat Waves and ‘Vulnerable’ Utilities
summary: Power failures have cast a spotlight on whether energy companies and regulators are doing enough to prepare for climate change and natural disasters.

title: Balancing Privacy With Data Sharing for the Public Good
summary: Socially valuable data can be combined with standards that safeguard individual privacy, an economist says.

title: Ahmed Zaki Yamani, Former Saudi Oil Minister, Dies at 90
summary: As Saudi Arabia’s powerful oil minister, he was architect of the Arab world’s drive to control its own energy resources in the 1970s.

title: Future Vaccines Depend on Test Subjects in Short Supply: Monkeys
summary: The pandemic has highlighted the United States’ dependence on China for research animals, reviving calls for a “strategic monkey reserve.”

title: Stocks Rise as Fed Chair Says Light at the End of the Tunnel Remains Distant
summary: Jerome Powell’s Senate testimony allayed worries that signs of growth would lead the Fed to cut back on its support for the economy.

title: Virus Did Not Bring Financial Rout That Many States Feared
summary: Grim forecasts held up for a few states, but many took in about as much tax revenue as before the pandemic — sometimes a lot more.

title: Exxon Mobil’s Chief Says It Is ‘Supportive’ of Zero-Emission Goals
summary: Darren Woods, in an interview before an annual presentation to investors, also suggested there was common ground with Biden administration policies.

title: OPEC and Russia Agree to Keep a Lid on Oil Production, Sending Prices Higher
summary: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies stuck with current quotas for April, with some exceptions. Saudi Arabia offered a similar compromise to the one it reached with Russia in January.

title: Oil Giants Prepare to Put Carbon Back in the Ground
summary: Climate concerns push BP and other firms to seek new roles as pollution fighters.

title: BP and other oil giants are betting big on being able to bury pollutants under the ocean.
Inflation Fear Lurks, Even as Officials Say Not to Worry
summary: Prices have yet to show much movement, but the prospect of an unbridled economy’s surging back from the pandemic has unsettled the markets.

title: A Decade After the Arab Spring, Autocrats Still Rule the Mideast
summary: The popular uprisings of 2011 mostly failed, but they gave the region a taste for democracy that continues to whet an appetite for change.

title: After a Decade of Chaos, Can a Splintered Libya Be Made Whole?
summary: An interim government promises peace, unity and democratic elections. Skeptical Libyans say they’ve heard this promise before.

title: Mexico Cries Foul at Natural Gas Cutoff Ordered by Texas Governor
summary: Amid his own push for Mexican energy sovereignty, President López Obrador said he was trying to stop a measure by Texas to restrict gas exports as both sides of the border suffered mass outages.

title: Erik Prince, Trump Ally, Violated Libya Arms Embargo, U.N. Report Says
summary: Mr. Prince offered to supply weapons, drones and mercenaries to a Libyan militia commander seeking to overthrow the government, according to U.N. investigators.

title: Venezuelan Women Lose Access to Contraception, and Control of Their Lives
summary: Affordable birth control has disappeared, pushing many women into unplanned pregnancies at a time when they can barely feed the children they already have.

title: Having Won Syria’s War, al-Assad Is Mired in Economic Woes
summary: After a decade of war, the biggest threat now to President Bashar al-Assad is an economic crisis. But at a recent meeting, he had no concrete solutions to his country’s extreme distress.

title: U.S. Sanctions Key Ukrainian Oligarch
summary: The Biden administration sees cleaning up corruption in Ukraine as the best protection against Russian influence.

title: Blasts at Equatorial Guinea Military Base Leave at Least 20 Dead and Hundreds Wounded
summary: Officials said mishandled explosives were responsible for the disaster in the Central African country.
